snippet: Bill de Blasio, a potential mayoral candidate, wants Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg to determine whether the police stops are warranted and based on reasonable suspicion.
abstract: New York City public advocate Bill de Blasio, possible Democratic contender in the 2013 mayoral race, calls on Mayor Michael R Bloomberg to force a reduction of the New York City Police Department's controversial stop-and-frisk tactic; issue holds great significance for left-leaning and black and Latino voters who can often sway the outcome of the Democratic mayoral primary.
lead_paragraph: Bill de Blasio, a potential mayoral candidate, wants Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg to determine whether the police stops are warranted and based on reasonable suspicion.

headline.seo: New York Public Advocate to Call for an Audit of Police Stop-and-Frisk Tactic
